citations.narrative:
On March 26, 2024, the facility started introducing the young male capybara, “Bagel”, to the herd in the established
capybara enclosure after several weeks of howdie cage interaction. During this introduction the facility reports that there
were several aggressive interactions with the established male, “Chai”, that resulted in “Bagel” limping on the right leg.
The following day, March 27, 2024, the facility attempted introduction again, and during this period “Chai” continued to be
aggressive toward “Bagel.” At one point the facility representatives monitoring this introduction became distracted, then
heard a loud sound, and when they looked, they noticed that “Bagel” was down in the hind legs. The attending
veterinarian examined “Bagel” right away and determined that both femurs (hind legs) were fractured. After discussion
with the AV, “Bagel” was humanely euthanized.
Animals housed in the in the same primary enclosure must be compatible. Failure to ensure compatibility can result in
injury or death.
Corrected at the time of inspection May 14, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.133  Critical
   
Separation. 
On March 26, 2024, the facility started introducing the young male capybara, “Bagel”, to the herd in the established 
capybara enclosure after several weeks of howdie cage interaction. During this introduction the facility reports that there 
were several aggressive interactions with the established male, “Chai”, that resulted in “Bagel” limping on the right leg. 
The following day, March 27, 2024, the facility attempted introduction again, and during this period “Chai” continued to be 
aggressive toward “Bagel.” At one point the facility representatives monitoring this introduction became distracted, then 
heard a loud sound, and when they looked, they noticed that “Bagel” was down in the hind legs. The attending 
veterinarian examined “Bagel” right away and determined that both femurs (hind legs) were fractured. After discussion 
with the AV, “Bagel” was humanely euthanized. 
 
Animals housed in the in the same primary enclosure must be compatible. Failure to ensure compatibility can result in 
injury or death.  
 
Corrected at the time of inspection May 14, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
